intro: Labordia triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered labordia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Labordia triflora produces small, round fruits that contain seeds covered in a silky, white coating. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
